oai_dc:dc.dc:title: AN EXPERIMENTAL STUDY ON BEACH TRANSFORMATION DUE TO WAVES UNDER THE OPERATION OF COASTAL DRAIN SYSTEM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sato, Michio
Hata, Sadakatsu
Fukushima, Masahiro
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: experimental study
beach transformation
coastal drain
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The performance of a coastal drain system was investigated experimentally. When the drain pipe was buried in the seaward area of a shoreline, the system was most effective. When the discharge is large, the drain system could accumulate a large amount of sediments on a beach face even under erosive wave conditions without drainage. The flow toward shore induced by drainage seemed to play an important role.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
